definition: to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to cup one's hands in salute/to surround/to arch/to dig earth with the snout/arched
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to watch from the sidelines and do nothing (idiom)
to bow and give way (idiom)/to surrender sth readily

sentences.english: You've got to hand it to the bottled water industry.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是把钱拱手交给矿泉水业。

sentences.english: Q. I know you said that you felt Blake gave that match away.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你说你感觉是Blake拱手让出了优势。

sentences.english: Re throwing away happiness with both hands. And reaching out for something that will never make you.
sentences.chinese: 你把自己的幸福拱手相让，去追求一些根本不会。

sentences.english: Soon thereafter, they relinquished the town to the Soviets.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后不久，他们把这错城镇拱手让给了苏维埃。

sentences.english: It does not clasp its hands and pray to Jupiter.
sentences.chinese: 它并不拱手向朱庇特大神祈祷。

sentences.english: Qin Dynasty of"moxa Xiao sleet is an arc hand, way, " big Xia's returning is actually a merchant to forget more matter.
sentences.chinese: 艾晓雪一拱手，道，“秦朝大侠还真是贵人多忘事啊。

sentences.english: You don't want to give away any more of your future 4） profits than you have to.
sentences.chinese: 除非万不得已，你不会想把更多未来的利润拱手让人。

sentences.english: I have ceded youth, and is willing to accompany you to the old.
sentences.chinese: 我早已将青春拱手相让，愿陪你到老。

sentences.english: Old Red-Nosed Gong lifted the bowl of yellow wine in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 红鼻子老拱手里擎了一碗黄酒。

sentences.english: According to this scale, chinese shift is equivalent to letting money submissively to Tecent.
sentences.chinese: 按照这个比例，中国移动相当于把钱拱手让给腾讯。

sentences.english: Eight years ago, it was shut down in a tacit admission that the US was ceding the market to China.
sentences.chinese: 八年前，美国秘而不宣地将市场拱手让给中国。

sentences.english: You're throwing away happiness with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 你把自己的幸福拱手相让。

sentences.english: Why take the opportunity to hand over the left to put out the lights to others?
sentences.chinese: 干嘛要把灭灯的机会拱手留给别人呢？

sentences.english: Handing her my relay position on a silver platter, that's what.
sentences.chinese: 把我的接力位置拱手相让，就是这样。

sentences.english: Ask yourself, my love, whether you are not very cruel to have so entrammelled me, so destoryed my freedom.
sentences.chinese: 你近乎残忍，让我无可自拔，将自由拱手相让。

definition: to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to salute/to greet
to bow
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to salute/to make one's salutations
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to greet by raising clasped hands
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to bow with hands held in front
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to cup one's hands in salute/to surround/to arch/to dig earth with the snout/arched
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
